incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Search Functionality

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Search. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 2:04 PM PDT and 10:32 PM PDT on June 7, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have received partial or no results in response to file searches. The issue occurred due to an underlying infrastructure issue where a Search cluster was missing a portion of its index. We were able to resolve the issue by immediately routing traffic to one of our backup clusters. In addition, we are working to add restrictions and additional checks to better prevent traffic from being routed to an incomplete index in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

On June 7th, we performed commands while troubleshooting a separate issue that inadvertently caused a Search cluster to serve customer traffic while missing a portion of its index. This resulted in some customer search queries returning with partial or no results. To remediate this issue, we routed traffic to one of our backup clusters.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Applying checks and restrictions to prevent actions that could result in an empty search index
* Using automation to perform further checks and restrictions
* Improving our alerting to catch situations where traffic is routed to an incomplete index

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. All services have been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
A fix has been implemented and we are continuing to monitoring the results.
We are investigating an ongoing issue affecting Search functionality inclusive of Metadata template search functionality. We have identified the cause and are working on a resolution.

incidents.name: [Minor] Issues with Public API and Downloads

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting certain parts of the Box Web App and public API, including Logins, Uploads and Downloads. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 11:35 AM PT and 12:42 PM PT on June 1, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users experienced slowness and intermittent failures interacting with certain parts of the Box webapp and public API, including Logins, Uploads and Downloads. The issue occurred as a result of a recent code change in our ongoing effort to improve performance and stability. We were able to resolve the issue by rolling back the code change.  We are working to improve our deployment and monitoring processes to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

Just prior to the start of the issue, we deployed a change that introduced a new database query in an attempt to simplify complex legacy queries and reduce database load. This new query was more expensive than anticipated, and caused the database to overload on larger tables in the production environment.  Customers may have experienced failed logins, uploads, and downloads as a result.  This change was tested in our pre-production environments for a week prior to release.  However, our pre-production environments have different load characteristics, making it difficult to identify the problem the query would cause under production load.  We are putting additional processes in place to thoroughly validate any database query changes prior to production deployment in order to prevent this from happening again.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Rework the solution to improve expensive database queries.
* Improve the deployment process to include more incremental stages, streamline the verification process, and expedite rollback speed.
* Formalize a process that tests DB effectiveness to better assess query impact when we adjust/create them

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

Our team has taken steps to remediate the issues with the Public API and Download services. This incident is now considered resolved and the Public API and Download services have been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating an ongoing issue affecting the Public API and downloads. We will provide more information as soon as it is available.

incidents.name: [Critical] Slowness when using Box

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box webapp. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

â

Between 12:43 AM PT and 1:44 AM PT on May 15, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, people using the Box webapp may have experienced increased latency or slowness. The issue occurred because of an erroneous change which constricted the amount of effective hardware capacity for the service dedicated to processing our webapp traffic. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the this change. In addition, we are improving our processes and observability techniques to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

â

â

**Analysis**

On Friday, May 12, 2023, we deployed a change aimed at improving the processing efficiency of our webapp traffic. Although this change did not result in any observed issues over the weekend, as our traffic increased as APAC and EMEA customers came back to work on Monday morning, it became evident that the change was constricting the effective capacity of the service responsible for processing our webapp traffic. Once this issue was detected, we were able to diagnose the issue and the problematic change was reverted. This ultimately remediated the problem.

â

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Adjusting our deployment processes to improve monitoring of changes during customer traffic peaks to better detect, diagnose and remediate such issues before customers are actually impacted.
* The efficiency change that caused the problem has been re-thought and is now implemented in the way that is much less likely to cause any customer impact.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.

â

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. WebApp Service has been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
Our team has taken steps to remediate this issue and is seeing improvement on WebApp. We are continuing to monitor for any additional impact.

Our team is investigating a slowness issue with the Box Web Application. Users may see slowness when attempting to login on the WebApp or accessing the All files page. We will provide additional information as it becomes available.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Metadata Queries

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Metadata Query API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Â 

Between 9am and 2pm PT on May 5th, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some requests to the Metadata Query API returned stale or outdated results. The issue occurred due to a delay in the replication of instance create and update events to the query datastore. We were able to resolve the issue by filtering out some events that were causing retries, dead lettering and hence delaying replication. In addition, we have identified the underlying pattern of events that was causing delays in the replication pipeline and patched our replication processing code to handle them gracefully, to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

â

**Analysis**Â 

When Metadata instances are mutated using the Box API or one of our applications, events containing the details of these mutations are emitted to a replication stream that is then processed by a pipeline without delay. This ensures the latest state is consistently available to be queried against using the Metadata Query API. We employ multiple optimizations to maintain the near-realtime characteristics of this query functionality, while ensuring all data is replicated consistently.

â

During this incident, one of the optimizations we leverage encountered an unexpected pattern of data, causing it return errors and trigger retries. These retries slowed down processing of the replication stream, causing lag to grow and resulting in queries returning outdated information for some customers. After identifying and filtering out these events causing errors, we were able to get the replication pipeline to once again successfully process events without adding delay. We also increased the rate at which these replication events are processed, in order to recover from the lag that had built up and fully catch up.

â

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Identified and patched for event pattern that caused errors and hence retries, ensuring graceful handling of unexpected data patterns.
* Increased batch size for replication stream processing to prevent lag from building up and to enable faster recovery from any backlogs in the future.
* Improved observability and increased sensitivity of alerts, to ensure faster detection of errors and/or lag build up.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Â 

Sincerely,

The Box Team
This incident has been resolved and Metadata Query functionality has been restored.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are actively investigating customer reports of an issue that may impact Metadata queries for our Content API. We will provide updates here as soon as possible.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads and Downloads

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting content ingress and egress. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 11:15 pm PT on April 25, 2023 and 8:40 am PT on April 26, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, one of our cloud partners experienced an infrastructure malfunction that impacted one of their European regions. This impact caused the region to exhibit elevated error rates and increased request latency which caused upload and download requests in Box to backup. We were able to resolve this issue by updating storage policies in this European region to use a different but still compliant region. In addition we have taken on a number of near term and longer term remediations to to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â   
  
**Analysis**   
Starting at approximately 7:00 pm PT on April 25, 2023 one of our European partners experienced an infrastructure problem in one availability zone of their France region. At 11:15 pm PT this malfunction triggered a fire that motivated an evacuation of datacenter personnel and resulted in region wide degradation. At this time requests that utilized storage in the impacted region saw increased latency and elevated error rates. This resulted in elevated request rates due to retries and longer request times. We remediated the issue by updating the storage policies to reroute the requests to another region that was still compliant with residency requirements, and by updating the behavior of internal retry and rate limiting logic.  
  
**Corrective Actions**  
The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Update internal rate limiting logic to trigger automatic scale-out sooner
* Update monitoring for all storage locations
* Audit request timeouts
* Extend automated health checking and automated policy re-routing to cover additional degradation cases

  
We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. The Uploads and Downloads services have been restored. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
A fix has been implemented and we're monitoring the results. If you are currently seeing any issues, please let us know at https://support.box.com.
We are investigating an ongoing issue affecting Uploads and Downloads. We will provide more information as soon as it is available.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads, Public API and Logins

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box Web App and public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

On April 19, 2023 between 21:02 and 22:02 \(Pacific Time\),  some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, these users experienced slowness and intermittent failures interacting with certain parts of the Box Web App and public API, including Logins, Uploads and Downloads. The issue occurred as a result of an internal process overloading the database pod responsible for serving approximately 1% of our customers. We were able to resolve the issue by stopping the internal process that was stressing the database. In addition, we have already started the process of upsizing and splitting the database as part of our routine maintenance for busy database pods to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

â

**Analysis**

At the beginning of 2022, the database pod on which this issue took place was identified as a candidate for splitting due to organic growth of the database. The split successfully completed in May 2022. In December 2022, the database pod was once again identified as a candidate for splitting due to additional organic growth since the previous split.  The second split kicked off in December and was estimated to complete in 8 weeks. However, a latent bug caused duplicate processing of some of the data on the pod; as a result, the split took longer than originally planned.  Load on the database pod continued to increase while the split was taking place and occasionally reached levels that were not sustainable, resulting in impact such as what was seen on April 19. While waiting for the split to be completed, the database pod was migrated onto more powerful hardware, providing some relief. The database split ultimately completed at the end of April 2022.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improve our database split process to reduce duplicative processing, improve efficiency in performing splits, and better scoping completion timeline. 

* Identify even earlier database pods that require a database split

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. The Uploads, Downloads, Logins and Public API services have been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
Our team is still investigating on this issue. However, we have observed improvements to Uploads, Downloads, Logins and Public API success metrics.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Public API, Box Relay and Box Sign

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box webapp. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 5:00 pm PT on April 16, 2023 and 1:00 am PT on April 17, 2023, as well as between 4:30 pm PT on April 17th and 2:00 am PT on April 18, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users experienced slowness and intermittent failures interacting with certain parts of the Box webapp and public API, including while applying Box Shield Classifications and sending documents for signature via Box Sign. The issue occurred as a result of a gradual new feature rollout that overwhelmed a cache held inside one of the key middleware services. We were able to resolve the issue by deploying a code change that prevented the feature rollout framework from overwhelming the cache and restarting the impacted service to clear the cache. In addition, we are working on improving monitoring and alerting around the impacted cache to be able to detect and address similar problems before they impact our users in the future.

â

**Analysis** 

Our investigation shows that the incident was caused by an inefficient configuration of the experimentation framework that was used to begin gradual rollout of a new feature. This framework unexpectedly stored decision results in the cache, regarding whether the feature should be shown to the user. This decision storage overran the cache, causing other entries to be evicted. This meant that the web application ended up having to reconstitute the frequently used and expensive to compute information that would have ordinarily been in this cache. The effective capacity of our web application processing was thus dramatically reduced, which caused exhaustion and subsequent degradation of several of our latency sensitive services. The incident remediation was slowed down significantly by the lack of explicit alerting on the web application serverâs cache.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Fix the experimentation framework such that it doesnât overwhelm the web application serverâs cache
* Add explicit monitoring and alerting around the usage of the web application serverâs cache
* Implement a fast way to clear the web application server caches on the entire server fleet
* Add explicit monitoring and alerting around expensive operations performed by the web application server that should ordinarily be performed rarely due to being cached effectively

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Major] Customers may experience issues uploading new documents to Box Sign

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box Sign. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 11:00 AM PT and 1:21 PM PT on April 7, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, Box Sign users were unable to start the signing process using the upload new file feature. Users were presented with an error banner when uploading new documents. The issue occurred as a result of a recent code change made to standardize error code messages, which inadvertently impacted an internal interaction. We were able to resolve the issue by rolling back the relevant change. In addition, we have identified several corrective actions, detailed below, to minimize the likelihood of similar issues occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

As part of an effort to standardize error codes returned in API responses, we rolled out a change that updated some existing codes. This change impacted an internal interaction, in the Box Sign document upload flow, that was explicitly relying on a prior error code value. When the relevant error situation arose, the code was unable to detect and mitigate the recoverable error, resulting in it being propagated out to the end-user in the form of an error banner.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Added additional tests to prevent modifications of existing error codes until it is deemed safe to do so.
* Started the process to deprecate custom error code values, only keeping the standardized HTTP response codes.
* Augmenting continuous end-to-end testing on pre-production environments for increased observability around critical user journeys.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

incidents.name: [Minor] Delays in Box Sync, Box Drive

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box Drive users. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 2:55am and 9:20am PDT on March 29th, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced delays in Box Drive synchronizing changes. The issue occurred due to a regularly scheduled automatic internal credential rotation failing to propagate completely. We were able to resolve the issue by manually synchronizing the affected service with the latest credentials. In addition, we are ensuring services self-validate against the credential freshness constraints to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis**

Key rotation is one aspect of the broader key management and a component Boxâs overall security system, which requires key holders to update their keys regularly before they are revoked. In the event an automatic key rotation occurs and a key holder does not refresh their credentials within their valid lifetime they will no longer be able to authenticate and receive authorization to communicate with external systems. In the case of this issue, a single internal service responsible for managing realtime events did not update its credentials following an automatic rotation and thus not able to make those new events available to our customers.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Add an alert to page on-call engineers should the affected service fail to update its credentials to enable a user to investigate and manually complete the task
* Update the affected service to add an additional automatic check for credential freshness to watch for rotations and update automatically

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

From approximately 3:00AM - 10:35AM US Pacific Time, users may have experienced delayed updates and results in Box Sync and Box Drive. This issue has since been resolved. If you are still encountering any issues with these services, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Critical] Issue With File Request Links

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting File Request. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 09:23 am PDT and 10:33 am PDT on March 24, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, users may have experienced failures of certain File Request operations. The issue occurred due to a scheduled change to add a new server in the service discovery cluster, which eventually impacted the File Request service. We were able to remediate this issue by reverting the change and performing a manual restart of the File Request service. Additionally, we have hardened the server deployment strategy to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future**.**Â 

â

**Analysis** 

File Request transitively relies on service discovery tools via using a distributed database system. An attempt to add a new server in the service discovery cluster triggered a chain reaction that ultimately caused all the file request database operations to timeout. 

After the addition was reverted, the file request service had to be manually restarted in order to reset the primary leader information cached by the database client in the service.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Proactively upgrade service discovery tools to more stable versions.
* Add additional server\(s\) to existing service discovery cluster to increase cluster fault tolerance.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Public API and Box Notes

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting JWT logins and Box Notes. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 5:37 AM and 6:39 AM PT, 9:37 PM and 10:39 PM PT on March 21, 2023, and between 9:12 AM PT and 9:39 AM PT on March 22, 2023 some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, we noticed some JWT-based logins resulting in failures as well as an increase in disconnects within Box Notes while users tried to save or delete their Notes. The issue occurred because of a configuration change on one of our caching servers, specifically in one of our maintenance scripts. We were able to resolve the issue by quarantining the affected host and manually replacing it with a healthy one. In addition, we have hardened our automated checks, added better controls in these maintenance scripts and also improved observability on the impacted caching services in order to to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

  
**Analysis** 

Logins at Box are rate limited in order to control the amount of traffic or requests that can be sent to our subsystems. During the time of the issue, the caching server that enables this rate limiting was shut down because of a misconfiguration in one of our maintenance scripts tasked with keeping our caching infrastructure up-to-date with the latest software patches. The script was trying to connect to its backend using an incorrect TLS certificate, causing the script to hang and consume system memory. Since this script runs on schedule, multiple instances of this script started over time causing it to consume more and more system resources.  Eventually, this led to insufficient resources being available for Memcached service, causing it to be terminated. Additionally, a bug in our auto-healing system prevented this caching server to be replaced with a healthy one leaving the server in service even though it was unhealthy. 

When part of the cache became unavailable, rate limiting service terminated the requests that were supposed to be cached in that server, causing approximately 30% of JWT logins to fail during that time. This same caching server was also used in the generation of OAuth2 tokens used internally within the BoxNotes service. When this cache would become unavailable, Box Notes would disconnect while trying to persist or delete a Note, since it could not validate the tokens. We noticed an increase of approximately 10% in the number of disconnects during the time of cache unavailability.

  
**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Validate that all necessary TLS certificates are present on the entire caching fleet.
* Fix the maintenance script so in case of a connection error, it terminates and does not hang and hold on to memory. 
* Fix the bug in the auto-healing system that prevented the unhealthy host from being replaced.
* Add more specific alerts in case of failures like these, so on-call engineers are better informed.

  
We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

  
Sincerely,

The Box Team

Our team has worked on the backlog to alleviate the degradation with API Authentication and Box Notes. We are considering this issue to be resolved. If you are still experiencing any issues, please let us know at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads and Logins

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box web application. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

â

On March 16th, 2023 between 4:30pm and 7:00pm PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced higher than usual latencies and slightly elevated error rates when interacting with the Box website. The issue occurred due to a mistake made as part of a maintenance operation aimed at improving the efficiency and reliability of one of our foundational services. This maintenance operation resulted in fewer servers being left to serve the Box web application than were necessary to serve all incoming traffic without any customer impact. We were able to resolve the issue by restoring the necessary capacity for the impacted service. In addition, we are implementing autoscaling for this service to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

â

**Analysis** 

The problem occurred over the course of a maintenance operation during which a legacy virtual-machine-based server fleet serving the Box web application was being replaced with a container-based fleet. Both fleets were sharing the load before the maintenance took place, and as the maintenance operation completed, only the container-based fleet remained. Although a load projection had been made prior to the maintenance and the container-based fleet was expected to be able to handle the full load of the site, it eventually became clear that our container-based fleet was struggling to keep up with demand. This resulted in higher latencies and slightly elevated error rates across the Box web application. In order to recover application performance, we put the virtual-machine-based fleet back in service to share the load with the container-based one.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* The capacity projection model for the container-based fleet has been adjusted to reflect the outcome of this maintenance. This means the more capacity will be available in the container-based fleet as we retire the virtual-machine-based fleet.
* We are improving our observability to detect early indicators of insufficient capacity, so we can react to them before customer experience is impacted.

 

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

From approximately 4:30PM to 7:30PM US Pacific time, we had an issue impacting downloads, uploads and logins. During this time users would have experienced increased latency navigating Box and timeouts for some uploads, downloads and login requests. No further impact has been observed and we are considering this issue to be resolved. If you are currently seeing any issues, please let us know at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Customers may have been experiencing failures when using Uploads or Public API

incident_updates.body:
_We recently addressed issues affecting file uploads and downloads. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future._

 

_Between 03:10 AM PT and 03:27 AM PT on March 15, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, certain file uploads and downloads may have failed. The issue occurred due to an automated security patching tool restarting a server, which caused some service discovery tools to fail. The issue resolved itself once the server restarted. As a result, we have hardened the server patching toolâs configuration to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future._Â 

â

_Analysis _

_The service discovery cluster requires a fixed number of minimum healthy servers running at any given time. The automated patching tool removed the primary service discovery server from the working server pool, at which point the cluster became unhealthy.  None of the remaining servers in the working pool assumed the primary role responsibility as expected, which resulted in a temporary interruption of the service discovery function.  Service discovery functionality resumed after the original primary server was patched and returned to the working pool._ 

â

_Corrective Actions_

_The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:_

* _Add additional server\(s\) to existing service discovery cluster to increase cluster fault tolerance._
* _Modify automated patching tool configuration to limit impact on existing service discovery cluster._
* _Migrate clients to use an updated and stable service discovery cluster version._
* _Add additional monitoring to check service discovery cluster readiness._

â

_We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter._Â 

 

_Sincerely,_

_The Box Team_

incidents.name: [MInor] Customers may have been experiencing failures when using Box Sign

incident_updates.body:
_We recently addressed issues affecting Box Sign. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future._

_Between March 13, 2023 and March 15, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have encountered loading issues while trying to sign a document. The issue occurred as a result of the release of a new feature in Box Sign. In connection with this release, there was a change in a specific flow for some enterprises based on their enterprise settings. We were able to resolve the issue in the short term by disabling the new feature in affected enterprises. We were subsequently able to release a fix that handled that flow properly. In addition, we are working on updating our monitoring and testing to minimize the likelihood of similar issues occurring in the future._Â 

  
_**Analysis **_

_Before signing a document using Box Sign, users must acknowledge an Electronic Record and Signature Disclosure \(ERSD\). The ERSD is presented on a modal that requires a user to mark a checkbox and submit their acknowledgment of the ERSD. Standard language is provided by default, but enterprises can change the text in their admin console or disable the ERSD._

_The ERSD text is received from our backend by the frontend and it shows a loading spinner until it receives this text. In connection with the release of a new feature in Box Sign, the event listener was not configured to properly handle situations in which the ERSD was disabled. This caused users for whom the ERSD was disabled to experience an endless loading loop and as a result, these users were temporarily unable to sign a document. We were able to resolve this issue by deploying the solution with proper handling of the event._ 

  
_**Corrective Actions**_

_The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:_

* _Add additional end to end tests for this particular use case._
* _Implement additional monitoring to closely track the duration for which the loading spinner is displayed._

  
_We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter._Â 

  
_Sincerely,_

_The Box Team_

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Search. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between March 7, 2023 5:00 PM PT and March 10, 2023 11:00 AM PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some recently uploaded and updated documents were delayed in processing and did not appear in Search results. The issue occurred during a code change to improve Searchâs processing capability. We were able to resolve the issue by removing the change and increasing the computing power of our pipeline. In addition, we have increased alerting and implemented stricter testing and more automation to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Analysis** 

At Box, we are always striving to improve the efficiency and fault tolerance of our services. The Search team implemented a change to improve the processing pipeline of documents that were uploaded to Box.

A bug went undiscovered during our automated and manual testing phases, leading to a lag in processing time. Once discovered and remediated, we immediately went about clearing the backlog of lagged items in our processing queue. This issue revealed gaps in our internal team process for such rollouts, in addition to gaps in our testing mechanisms.

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Add in more alerting and automated processes to prevent future complications
* Long-term migration to more stable sub-systems
* Extra automation around testing rollouts for changes to the processing pipeline

incidents.name: [Major] Degradation of Search

incident_updates.body:
_We recently addressed issues affecting the Search service. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future._

Â 

_Between 1:05 PM PT on February 9, 2023 and 3:00 AM PT on February 11, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users were unable to search for items that were uploaded or changed during the impacted timeframe. The issue occurred as a result of an automation intended to optimize our messaging infrastructure. The automation put in place did not drive the optimization at a controlled rate, which caused overutilization of available resources and resulted in end-user impact. We resolved this issue by stopping the optimization automation. In addition, we have added guardrails to limit the optimization process to a subset of infrastructure to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future._Â 

_Analysis_Â 

_On the day of the incident, we observed increased disk activity in our messaging infrastructure. This was the result of an automated optimization process to balance out disk space evenly across the underlying hosts in our messaging infrastructure. The optimization process ran across all the hosts, resulting in increased disk activity that affected our search service. As a result of this issue, our search service temporarily failed to index any file changes made after the onset of the issue. As a result, we stopped the optimization automation, and as a result, we observed incremental recovery until all the messages were processed. The issue was completely resolved February 11, 2023 at approximately 3:00 AM PT._

_Corrective Actions_

_The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:_

_We have restricted our disk space optimization process to limit the hosts to process at a given time._

_We have identified additional alerts and checks to detect and diagnose issues with messaging infrastructure proactively._  

_We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter._Â 

Â 

_Sincerely,_

_The Box Team_

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. Search has been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Minor] Issue with Uploads, Downloads, and Public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the customers for Downloads, Uploads and Public API services. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

â

On January 31, 2023 between 12:02 AM PST and 12:27 AM PST and on February 9, 2023 between 11:03 PM PST and 11:28 PM PST, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced issues with Logins, Notes, Downloads, Uploads & Public API services. 

â

**Analysis**

On the day of the incident \(Jan 31st 12:02 AM\), it was observed that an internal Garbage Collection process triggered; which caused the system to pause from responding to services hosted on it. This caused a high internal queue build up as the system backlog built due to CPU resource contention.  As the queue size build up was significant, the recovery took some time. 

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* We are working towards reviewing and adding more alerting for improved diagnostics for such issues. 
* We have added a caching layer to reduce the dependency between our backend datasets and customer applications. This should reduce the potential impact to the customer experience if we face a similar issue.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

From approximately 11:02 PM to 11:28 PM AM US Pacific time, we had an issue impacting downloads, uploads and public API. During this time users would have experienced increased latency navigating Box and timeouts for some uploads, downloads and public API requests. Our systems automatically detected and corrected the underlying issue. There is no current impact and no further updates will be provided here. If you are currently seeing any issues, please let us know at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads, Box Notes, API and Logins

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting the Box Service. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 10:24am PST and 11:20am PST on February 6th, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, a subset of Boxâs external load balancers became unstable due to extremely high CPU usage, which resulted in intermittent issues for customers trying to access the Box Service. The issue occurred as a result of network socket exhaustion on external load balancers which was caused by a migration of certain traffic to the public cloud. We were able to resolve the issue by rolling back the migration at issue as well as increasing available load balancer capacity. In addition, we are working on updating the required amount of resources and capacity we need in the public cloud for these migrations as well as improving our monitoring to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

â

As Box moves to the public cloud, we have migrated multiple workloads from our on-prem datacenters to the public cloud. The service in question is responsible for an extremely high connection count. While moving this service away from the last on-prem datacenter it occupied, the load balancers in the public cloud became temporarily overwhelmed. This resulted in the exhaustion of available network sockets for the load balancers to use. This drove up CPU usage as a result of connection retries, eventually causing instances to fail healthchecks and be recreated. As instances were being recreated, they would drop traffic and move the high connection count to a different instance, further compounding the issue. We were able to resolve this issue by rolling back the migration, which relieved the connection counts on the load balancers. Furthermore, by adding more capacity we were able to provide the necessary headroom to recover completely. We are working on adding capacity to our cloud load balancing stack and updating our monitoring to immediately point to the root cause if a similar issue is encountered in the future.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Add additional capacity to the public cloud load balancing stack
* Update existing monitoring to account for network socket usage and exhaustion

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating an ongoing issue affecting  uploads, downloads and Notes and logins.  We will provide more information as soon as it is available.

incidents.name: [Major] Issue with Box Uploads/Downloads

incident_updates.body:
_We recently addressed issues affecting uploads and downloads for Box. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future._

â

_Between February 3, 2023 at 9:09 PM PST and February 4, 2023 at 11:20 AM PST, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced failures when attempting to upload or download content to Box. We were able to resolve the issue by deploying additional resources and scaling up our services. In addition, we are working on improving our change management process to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future._Â 

â

_Analysis _

_The issue was a result of a change from HTTP metrics communication in the region to HTTPS metrics communication. This change failed and resulted in a communication failure between our metrics agent and the metric sink it writes to. During the communication failure, the metrics agent will locally cache the data up to a max capacity. In our deployments, we did not have enough resources deployed for this cache. The impact was resource exhaustion in a cluster running our upload and download services resulting in frequent service restarts due to an out-of-memory exception_

â

_Corrective Actions_

_The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:_

* _Increased the deployment resources to allow for the additional capacity_ 
* _Added specific alerting for this scenario_ 

â

_We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter._Â 

 

_Sincerely,_

_The Box Team_

We have identified an issue that impacted the customer experience with uploads/downloads. We believe the issue has been stabilized and the experience with uploads/downloads has been restored to normal. If you are experiencing any issues, please let us know at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Admin Reports Issue

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Enterprise Reporting. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

â

Between 10:00 AM PST on January 31, 2023, and 4:00 PM PST on February 1, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some enterprise admins may have experienced delays running Box admin reports. The issue occurred due to backend resource exhaustion in our reporting system. We were able to resolve the issue by removing idle reporting resources and adjusting our internal configurations governing recycling of idle reporting resources. In addition, to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future, we will be provisioning additional monitoring to detect an excess buildup of idle reporting resources before they impact the customer experience.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

The Enterprise Reporting product dynamically creates compute clusters to run reports requested by customers and then destroys them once they are idle in order to free up capacity for new clusters to be launched. The root cause of this issue was that the process responsible for destroying these reporting compute clusters was unable to keep up with the rate at which clusters were scheduled for destruction, creating a backlog that eventually resulted in temporary exhaustion of the compute resource available to run customer reports. As a result, some enterprise admins may have experienced delays in running reports during the impacted timeframe. Additionally, this issue took longer to detect than it otherwise may have because our monitoring initially failed to distinguish the resulting customer report backlog from the expected higher customer reporting traffic that typically occurs at the end of each month.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Update the reporting cluster destruction process so that it can keep pace with the rate at which clusters are provisioned
* Add direct monitoring for a backlog of reporting clusters that are scheduled for destruction
* Add direct monitoring for exhaustion of available reporting compute resources

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

We are currently investigating reports of an issue impacting the availability of Admin Reports. We have identified the cause of the issue and are actively working to remediate impact to the customer experience. 

Update - The issue appears to be remediated. Admin Reports are back to being operational.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads, public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Uploads and Downloads. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 Between January 23, 2023 at 11:46 am PST and January 26, 2023 at 3:11 pm PST, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, a newly re-deployed load balancer instance had a faulty network connection that caused it to be unreachable from our internal network. This resulted in timeouts for any traffic processed by this load balancer, and as a result, users may have experienced upload or download operations time out. We were able to resolve the issue by removing the faulty instance from the pool. In addition, we are working on improving our health-checks for newly deployed instances to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

**Analysis** 

In our public cloud infrastructure, we use managed instance groups \(MIGs\) to regulate and group load balancers that function as backends for the external load balancer. The issue started when a scheduled re-deploy task created a load balancer instance with an incorrect internal network configuration. Additionally, our existing health checks did not account for validating the instanceâs internal connectivity. As a result, all traffic that was sent to this particular instance timed out, in addition to any telemetry that would have been generated by the instance. The issue was corrected by removing the instance from the group, and we are working on improving our health checking as well as observability to reduce the risk of similar issues occurring again in the future. 

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Importing missing external load balancer metrics to observability platforms for alerting and dashboards
* Adding additional pre-enable health-checks to new load balancer instances

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved.
Please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com/ if you continue to experience any issues

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads and metadata

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box activity, including Box Metadata, file uploads and downloads, Box Notes, and the public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

On January 23rd from 11:48am PT to 1:07pm PT and on January 24th from 7:49am PT to 8:36am PT and 5:07pm PT to 9:02pm PT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users experienced higher than normal latency and/or timeouts when trying to access content in Box via one of our applications or our Public API. Specifically, some users of the Metadata Query API experienced elevated latencies and timeouts.

â

**Analysis** 

The issue occurred due to  an overload of a localized area of one of our datastores, resulting in the request queue backing up and causing latency degradation for Downloads, Box Notes, Metadata and other related services for some users. This additional load was induced by an internal data migration our engineering team was performing at that time. One of the changes needed to perform this migration caused an unexpected amplification of requests to a localized area of one of our datastores containing schema information. This change was tested prior to deployment, performed as expected after deployment, but caused impact at peak load.

â

Requests to this server developed a backlog which affected latency of Box Metadata generally, resulting in elevated latencies and some timeouts for dependent Box services. We were able to resolve the issue by reducing load on this datastore via additional caching, shedding some load and rolling back some recent changes. We are working on process and tooling improvements to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Patched a bug in our data migration code that caused read requests amplification and validated it.
* Closed a gap in observability, in order to identify similar load increases before they reach a tipping point and cause impact.
* Increased capacity for this localized area that holds schema information, in order to handle any future surges in traffic more gracefully.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

We have identified and resolved issues impacting uploads, downloads, metadata and Public API. Services should operate as normal at this time.

If you continue to experience issues with uploads, downloads, metadata and Public API, please reach out to our support team for further assistance at http://support.box.com.

At approximately 01/23/2023 11:51 AM, we have started observing issues impacting uploads, downloads, metadata and Public API. 
Engineering has identified and resolved the issue. We will continue to monitor for any further issues.

â

incidents.name: [Minor] Issue with Uploads, Downloads, and Public API

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Desktop Applications \(Box Sync, Box Drive\), Box Web Application \(Uploads/Downloads\), and Box Platform / API \(Uploads/Downloads\). We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 3:30pm PDT and 4:17pm PDT on Jan 9th, 2023, some users may have experienced difficulties while working on the Box platform. During this time, users may have experienced slow login times as well as failures when attempting to upload and download files. 

## **Analysis**

The issue occurred as an unexpected result of a resource utilization priority conflict during the deployment process of an internal tool. Specifically, an internal service being deployed to our production environment had a higher resource utilization priority than another critical system process, which subsequently failed when affected nodesâ resources were exhausted. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change.

In addition, we are improving our change risk assessment criteria and health alerts for this kind of tool, and working to design a more progressive deployment process for this internal tool to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

## **Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving our risk assessment criteria for deploying these types of tools. 

* Extending our capacity guidelines to provide more clarity around system resource consumption and better resource distribution.
* Increasing our alerting to detect early warning signs of systems running at a higher capacity than expected.

 

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. All services have been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.
Our team has taken steps to remediate this issue and is seeing improvement for these services. We are continuing to monitor for any additional impact.

Our team is investigating an issue with Uploads, Downloads, the Public API, and Box Web Application. Users may see errors or slowness when attempting to use these services. We will provide additional information as it becomes available.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Downloads and performance with Box.com

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Box activity, including Box Metadata, file uploads and downloads, Box Notes, and the public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 9:44 pm PST on December 4, 2022 and 12:32 am PST on December 5, 2022 and between 4:00 pm PST and 5:53 pm PST on December 5, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some users may have experienced higher than normal latency and/or timeouts when trying to access content in Box via one of our applications or our Public API. The issue occurred due to a sudden surge in traffic to a localized area of our metadata cluster, resulting in increased request queue latencies and degradation of Downloads, Box Notes, Metadata and other related services. The issue was resolved after the traffic to the servers hosting the data was decreased. We have since then made observability improvements to identify similar traffic surges faster and are working on process and tooling improvements to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

â

**Analysis** 

This issue occurred due to a sudden surge in traffic to a localized area of our metadata cluster. Although Box is designed to be capable of handling short surges in traffic, this issue was caused by a sustained increase in traffic directed to a single server. As a result, requests to this server developed a backlog, which affected latency of Box Metadata generally; this resulted in users experiencing degradation of uploads, downloads, Box Notes, and other related services. The issue was resolved after the traffic to server hosting the data was decreased.  We are working on improvements to how data is sharded and cached and also process and tooling improvements to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Added observability improvements to identify similar traffic surges more rapidly
* Added additional caching to proactively limit localized surges in traffic to individual servers
* Added the ability to quickly react and throttle surges in traffic to individual servers
* Improving resilience of Box services to high latencies when accessing data stores to minimize the impact of any similar issues in the future

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved.  Performance with Box.com has been restored to full functionality. If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

Our team has taken steps to remediate this issue and Box.com service should be returned to full functionality. We are continuing to monitor for any additional impact and will follow up with additional information.

incidents.name: [Minor] Issues Accessing Box

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting access to Box for some customers. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between 2:13 am PST and 2:55 am PST on December 1, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time. users of some enterprises with Device Trust checks enabled may have experienced intermittent 500 errors when logging in to Box or accessing the All Files page. 

â

**Analysis** 

The issue occurred as a result of a recent code change related to Box's Device Trust feature. Due to incorrect estimates of user traffic, the authentication flow service would transiently block some users from accessing Box. We were able to revert the problematic code and correct faulty assumptions in the days following the incident.  In addition, our performance testing has been revised and new observability measures have been implemented to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improving Device Trust performance testing process to provide a reasonable safety buffer.
* Improving Device Trust observability to revert faulty changes at the time of deployment.
* Increasing Device Trust hardware resources.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

From approximately 2:13AM-2:55AM PT, some users may have experienced intermittent 500 errors when logging in to Box or accessing the All Files page. This issue was automatically detected by our internal monitoring and a fix was implemented. If you are still experiencing any issues with these services, please contact Box Support via https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Shield - Admin, Classification, Manual Classification.

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting Shield and Classification. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 5:16 PM PDT and 7:40 PM PDT on November 23, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, it was not possible to access Shield Admin pages, the Shield Admin dashboard and the Classification Label admin pages. Additionally, some users may have experienced issues manually classifying files and folders. The issue occurred as a result of an inadequate capacity configuration that prevented a service from starting gracefully after rebooting. We were able to resolve the issue by increasing the capacity of the affected service. In addition, we are working to extend our capacity guidelines and to improve our alerting capabilities to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

The service affected by this incident recently experienced a significant increase in traffic as a result of the release of a new feature. Although the service remained stable after the featureâs release, the temporary degradation of another supporting service resulted in an increased number of retries, which in turn resulted in increased processing activity. As a result of this increased CPU usage, the impacted service eventually rebooted, but was unable to effectively reboot because the memory currently allocated for that service was inadequate during this window of increased processing activity. We were able to resolve the issue by increasing the capacity of the affected service.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Extending our capacity guidelines to provide more clarity around system restart considerations.
* Increasing our alerting to detect early warning signs of systems running at a higher capacity than expected.
* Improving the documentation of our existing alerts to allow us to respond more quickly to system reboot issues.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

 

Sincerely,

The Box Team

After further monitoring, this incident is now considered resolved. Box Shield Service has been restored to full functionality. 

If you continue to experience any issues, please contact Box Support at https://support.box.com.

incidents.name: [Major] Latency with Some Box Services

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting permissions checks in multiple Box services. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

On November 23rd, 2022 between 10:39 AM and 11:29 AM, some users may have experienced difficulties while accessing content in Box. During this time, permissions checks were not available for certain workflows, which caused multiple services to stop allowing access. The issue occurred due to a non-backward-compatible change that was introduced while adding a feature intended to improve the performance of permissions checks. We were able to resolve the issue by reverting the change. In addition, we are working to improve our testing and monitoring processes to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis**

Permissions checks depend on a schema. In order to make checks faster, we are adding support for bulk lookups, a feature that will reduce the number of requests to other internal services and thus improve the response time. Some new fields required for the bulk-lookups feature were added in a way that made the change non-backward-compatible, causing services to fail in production. This failure rendered the permissions system temporarily unable to grant access to certain content in Box.

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Add tests to ensure backwards-compatibility.
* Enhance our code-review checklist to add looking for non-backwards-compatible changes.
* Improve our deployment process to add more training for developers who publish permissions changes.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

From approximately 10:30AM-11:37AM PT, users may have experienced intermittent issues loading some Box services including the Admin Console, Collections, Annotations, File Request Links, Notification Center, and Relay. This issue was automatically detected by our internal monitoring and a fix was implemented. incidents.name: [Major] Issues with generating Content Preview

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting conversion latencies for Sharepoint or Microsoft Excel files. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

Between November 15, 2022 at 7:12 am PST and November 16, 2022 at 3:04 am PST, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, customers may have experienced preview conversion latencies for Sharepoint or Microsoft Excel files. The issue occurred as a result of a reduction of available conversion capacity as part of ongoing data center migrations. We were able to resolve the issue by provisioning additional capacity in their place. In addition, operational process and tooling will be implemented to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â 

â

**Analysis** 

As part of a data center migration, hosts for the conversion service were removed from production before replacement capacity was brought online, resulting in a 15% loss to conversion capacity. The capacity loss and root cause were identified right away and additional capacity was brought online to compensate. 

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Process updates have been enabled to better facilitate communication between Infrastructure and Capacity teams to minimize the likelihood of similar issues occurring in the future.
* Changes to automation for the validation of capacity requests have been enacted.
* Canary rollout of windows related changes for the conversion service will be enabled. 

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team

incidents.name: [Major] Issues with Uploads, Downloads and Box Notes

incident_updates.body:
_We recently addressed issues affecting uploads, downloads and notes. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future._

 

_On October 19, 2022 between 6:34 AM PDT and 9:25 AM PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some Box users may have experienced issues with uploads, downloads, notes, and public API. The issue occurred as a result of an IPSec link failure, which resulted in intermittent packet loss and latency._

â

_Analysis _

â

_As Box moves to GCP, we are in a transitionary period where we run a subset our services on GCP and on-prem. During a recent event, we had a secure network link failure that caused traffic saturation. During this time, services connecting GCP and our on-prem data center had communication impact, which led to an impact to Box services used by customers._ 

â

_Corrective Actions_

_The following corrective actions have been completed:_

* _Quickly recovered the failed link to address the underlying issue._
* _Doubled additional capacity to avoid this issue from occurring again in the future._

â

_We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter._Â 

 

_Sincerely,_

_The Box Team_

incidents.name: [MAJOR] Issues with API uploads, downloads and previewing Microsoft Office Online

incident_updates.body:
We recently addressed issues affecting uploads, downloads, notes, and public API. We would like to take the opportunity to further explain these issues and the steps we have taken to keep them from happening in the future.

 

Between 6:55 pm PDT and 7:07 pm PDT on October 16, 2022, some users may have experienced difficulties while working in Box. During this time, some Box users may have experienced issues with uploads, downloads, notes and public API. The issue occurred as a result of a latent issue with platform workload initialization controllers failing to detect new workloads. 

â

**Analysis** 

This issue was the result of a controller component that provides service-to-service authentication failing to detect that new workloads needed to be processed. This controller monitors an internal API for new workloads that match certain criteria indicating that the workloads are initializing and waiting for internal credentials. In this case, the impacted controller failed to detect new workloads waiting in the API results that should have been processed. We were able to resolve the issue by restarting the controllers and the new workloads were processed. In addition, we also added alerts to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.Â The existing alerting in place was monitoring the controllers for errors, but because the controllers were idle, no alerts were immediately raised. 

â

**Corrective Actions**

The following corrective actions have been completed or are planned:

* Improve alerting on the workloads if they time out while waiting for the controller to process them.
* Replace the controller with a more robust method of authenticating workloads.

â

We are continuously working to improve Box and want to make sure we are delivering the best product and user experience we can. We hope we have provided some clarity here and we would be happy to answer any questions you may still have regarding this matter.Â 

Sincerely,  
The Box Team
From approx 7:00 PM-8:00 PM PDT, we had observed issues with uploads and downloads for our API service in addition to previewing with Microsoft Office Online. The issue has since been resolved.
